author: yorickdowne
content: This interacts in interesting ways with Fusaka. I don’t think giving clients the task to support another testnet pre-Fusaka is reasonable, so this’d launch post-Fusaka - right when everyone needs a holiday break.

author: yorickdowne
content: There is also the option to not do that - pros and cons. Pro, dApps don’t need to redeploy; con, they don’t exercise their ability to do so. And - is Ethereum responsible for forcing them to?

author: parithosh
content:
Its still under discussion and we haven't brought it up on ACD yet - but the team is internally leaning on not doing so this year. We just had a lot of testnet chaos earlier this year with Holesky/Hoodi that triggered a lot of re-deployments + the the interactions with fusaka timelines. We also got feedback from dapps/etc that they'd like testnets to churn less frequently - and I can see them changing 2x deployments in under a year as a lot of churn. Similar issues with documentation and tooling, we're yet to see full coverage for Hoodi. 

So the proposal we're considering is to start up a new testnet maybe Q2' 26, giving us some respite from testnet churn. But this is still pending discussion on ACD of course.
